reference.shortdesc: A superscript is a letter, number, or figure that is printed above than the line. It is frequently used in chemical and mathematical formulas; it also is used for footnotes.

section.title: Formatting expectations
section.p: Although rendering is left up to implementations, processors typically apply render the contents of the sup element in superscript highlighting or placed higher in relationship to the surrounding text. Superscript text also is often a smaller font than the surrounding text.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The sup element is specialized from ph.

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: The power produced by the electrohydraulic dam was 1010 more than the older electric plant. The difference was H2O.
